description: Indicates that the style extensions (style, markdown and xhtml) in this resource instance are essential to the interpretation of the instance and that systems that are not capable of rendering using those extensions should not be used to render the resource.

element.comment: If set to true, all systems that claim to support this extension and that render elements from the resource SHALL either render the content as required by the style extensions ([style](extension-rendering-style.html), [xhtml](extension-rendering-xhtml.html) and [markdown](extension-rendering-markdown.html) or shall indicate to the user that the resource (or specific elements in the resource) cannot be appropriately rendered by the system.
element.definition: Indicates that the style extensions (style, markdown and xhtml) in this resource instance are essential to the interpretation of the instance and that systems that are not capable of rendering using those extensions should not be used to render the resource.

name: styleSensitive

element.comment: If set to true, all systems that claim to support this extension and that render elements from the resource SHALL either render the content as required by the style extensions ([style](extension-rendering-style.html), [xhtml](extension-rendering-xhtml.html) and [markdown](extension-rendering-markdown.html) or shall indicate to the user that the resource (or specific elements in the resource) cannot be appropriately rendered by the system.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
